Content:
I can't see this working if the tanks need to be this large. As battery efficiency increases, the big four Japanese mfrs. are going to get left behind if they don't get on the EV bandwagon now. The EV batteries are getting better and lighter and the weight problem is going to go away as is the charging times. They are already way down in some models.

Kawasaki’s Supercharged Hydrogen-Fueled H2
A consortium of Japanese manufacturers in both the motorcycling and automotive spaces are working on hydrogen-powered vehicles and practical means of refueling.
www.cycleworld.com

Those are not panniers on the sides, those are hydrogen fuel tanks. There is not even room for a passenger.
